newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka to unveil new mineral policy soon.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka to unveil new mineral policy soon.

text.p: Sri Lanka will shortly unveil a new mineral policy that will give private enterprises the prime role in commercial exploration and mining, an Industries Ministry official said on Friday.
"We believe commercial exploration and exploitation should be done by the private sector," said the official, who declined to be identified.

Companies with proven experience can apply for an exploration licence and will be given the sole authority to explore a given area as well as priority over others in mining any minerals which may be found, he said.
"The government does not have the money nor the technology for large scale commercial exploration and mining," he added.
The government will do a limited amount of exploration and mining mostly for geological mapping, he said.
Under the policy, the government will also encourage the setting up of value- added mineral industries, he said.
The draft policy also tightens environmental measures as well as standards to protect the health of workers, he said.
"The minerals industry can sometimes have a devastating impact on the environment," he said.
Bureau officials said several multinational firms have sought exploration rights to look for gold and minerals in the Indian Ocean island.
Sri Lanka has deposits of mineral sands, quartz and phosphate among other minerals.
